solution.text:
Given expression :
_{i}_cos(A) + _{j}_cosec(A)
write cos(A) as \(1\over sec(A)\)
now we know sec(A) = \(\sqrt {1+tan^2(A)}\) and
cosec(A) = \(\sqrt {1+cot^2(A)}\)
which gives :
\(_{i}_\over \sqrt {1+tan^2(A)}\)+_{j}_\(\sqrt {1+cot^2(A)}\)
now write cot(A) as \(1\over tan(A)\)
i.e., \(_{i}_\over \sqrt {1+tan^2(A)}\)+_{j}_\(\sqrt {1+{1\over tan^2(A)}}\)
i.e., \(_{i}_\over \sqrt {1+tan^2(A)}\)+_{j}_\(\sqrt {tan^2(A)+1\over tan^2(A)}\)
i.e., \(_{i}_\over \sqrt {1+tan^2(A)}\)+_{j}_\(\sqrt {tan^2(A)+1}\over tan(A)\)
i.e., \(_{i}_tan(A)+_{j}_(1+tan^2(A))\over tan(A)*\sqrt {(1+tan^2(A))}\)

content.text: Write the given expression _{i}_cos(A) + _{j}_cosec(A) in terms of tan(A).
